Comparison of Main Theoretical Perspectives on Contrast Capability Framing versus Ethical Framing of AI:

1. Artificial Intelligence (AI) development focuses on creating machine-based intelligence that can pass the Turing Test, thus being considered intelligent [1]. Here, the evaluation and creation of intelligent models are paramount. 2. The EU Ethics Guidelines for Trustworthy AI emphasize ensuring lawful, ethical, and robust AI systems to prevent unintended or dual-use applications causing harm [2]. This perspective stresses sociotechnical and human-centric considerations. 3. Large Language Models (LLMs) have gained significant attention due to their impressive performance, raising the possibility that they could be considered AGI [1]. However, insufficient evidence is provided regarding the ethical implications of LLMs in this context. 4. The Turing Test was proposed in the 1950s as a benchmark for assessing intelligence by discerning human and machine responses [6]. This test serves as a historical marker for AI evolution.
